page.title: 11RINGLEY BRIDGE AND STOCKS
page.content: {RINGLEY BRIDGE}WAS BUILT IN{1677}AND COST{Â£500}.IT WAS BUILT TO REPLACE A WOODEN BRIDGE WHICH WAS WASHED AWAY IN {1673}.WHILE THERE WAS NO BRIDGE,PEOPLE HAD TO CROSS THE{RIVER IRWELL}BY BOAT. THE BRIDGE WAS DECLARED AN{ANCIENT {MONUMENT}IN{1950}. IN{JUNE 1938}THE BRIDGE WAS CLOSED SO THAT REPAIRS COULD BE MADE TO THE SURFACE AT A COST OF{Â£30 000.} THE COBBLES WERE TAKEN UP SO THAT A LAYER OF WATERPROOFED CONCRETE COULD BE LAID.THE WORK WAS DONE BY{GREATER {MANCHESTER COUNCIL}. {STOCKS} BESIDE THE BRIDGE THERE ARE SOME STOCKS WHICH PROBABLY DATE BACK FROM THE{SEVENTEENTH}CENTURY,BUT NO RECORD OF THE STOCKS REMAIN.
